input_output.uvtable_filename: UVTable with data to be fit (columns: u [\lambda], v [\lambda], Re(V) [Jy], Im(V) [Jy], weights [Jy^-2])
input_output.save_dir: Directory in which output datafiles and figures are saved
input_output.save_profile_fit: Whether to save fitted brightness profile
input_output.save_vis_fit: Whether to save fitted visibility distribution
input_output.save_uvtables: Whether to save fitted and residual UV tables (these are reprojected)
input_output.iteration_diag: Whether to return and save diagnostics of the fit iteration (needed for diag_plot)
input_output.format: Output file format. Default is the same as for 'uvtable_filename', else choose from 'npz' or 'txt'

modify_data.baseline_range: (Deprojected) baseline range outside of which visibilities are truncated, unit=[\lambda]
modify_data.correct_weights: Whether to estimate the data's weights (as they may be unknown for mock data)

geometry.type: How the geometry is determined: 'known' if user-supplied, 'gaussian' if it is to be fit
geometry.fit_phase_offset: Whether to fit for the phase center or just the inclination and position angle

hyperparameters.n: Number of collocation points used in the fit (suggested range 100 - 300)
hyperparameters.rout: Maximum disc radius in the fit (best to overestimate size of source), unit=[arcsec]
hyperparameters.alpha: Order parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested range 1.00 - 1.50). If a list, multiple fits will be performed and overplotted.
hyperparameters.p0: Scale parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested >0, <<1)
hyperparameters.wsmooth: Strength of smoothing applied to the power spectrum (suggested range 10^-4 - 10^-1). If a list, multiple fits will be performed and overplotted.
hyperparameters.iter_tol: Tolerance for fit iteration stopping criterion (suggested <<1)
hyperparameters.nonnegative: Whether frank provides the mean (if false) or best fit nonnegative solution

plotting.quick_plot: Whether to make a figure showing the simplest plots of the fit
plotting.full_plot: Whether to make a figure more fully showing the fit and its diagnostics
plotting.diag_plot: Whether to make a diagnostic figure showing fit convergence metrics
plotting.deprojec_plot: Whether to make a figure showing the effect of deprojection on the (u, v) points and visibilities
plotting.distance: Distance to source, optionally used for plotting, unit=[pc]
plotting.force_style: Whether to use preconfigured matplotlib rcParams in generated figures
plotting.bin_widths: Bin widths in which to bin the observed visibilities, list of float or int, unit=[\lambda]
plotting.gamma: Index of power law normalization to apply to swept profile image colormaps (1.0 = linear scaling)
plotting.iter_plot_range: Range of iterations to be plotted in the diagnostic figure, list of int of the form [start, stop]

analysis.compare_profile: Path of file with comparison profile to be overplotted with frank fit (.txt or .dat; columns: r [arcsec], I [Jy / sr])
analysis.clean_beam: B_major [arcsec], B_minor [arcsec], position angle [deg] of beam to convolve frank profile (list of len 3)
analysis.bootstrap_ntrials: Number of trials (dataset realizations) to perform in a bootstrap analysis
